channel.title: Comments on: Building your webapp in the cloud

item.title: By: Ed Byrne
item.dc:creator: Ed Byrne
item.description:
@John - you shouldn't have to have time to learn and play with cloud computing - it should be as easy (or easier) than standard development, just on a much better platform.
We'd be happy to host a session on-site in our Data Centre and aside from just talking about Cloud Computing, we can show you a real platform. Of course in return we'd like to hear what web application developers REALLY want from their app hosting providers!
item.content:encoded:
@John – you shouldn’t have to have time to learn and play with cloud computing – it should be as easy (or easier) than standard development, just on a much better platform.

We’d be happy to host a session on-site in our Data Centre and aside from just talking about Cloud Computing, we can show you a real platform. Of course in return we’d like to hear what web application developers REALLY want from their app hosting providers!

item.title: By: John
item.dc:creator: John
item.description:
Conor, Would be very interested in attending such an event. Personally I would be interested in hearing a mix of biz and tech (with more tech than biz). I have never done any cloud development but armed with my app engine account I am desperately looking for some time to learn and play.
John
item.content:encoded:
Conor,
Would be very interested in attending such an event. Personally I would be interested in hearing a mix of biz and tech (with more tech than biz). I have never done any cloud development but armed with my app engine account I am desperately looking for some time to learn and play.

John

item.title: By: Stephen McCarron
item.dc:creator: Stephen McCarron
item.description:
We've a few presentations online - http://edbyrnehq.com/cloud-computing-the-evolution-of-internet-infrastructure/ - is the most recent one.
The API has been key for us, we'll be launching it soon, along with a new 'cloud' brand distinct from our 'regular' managed services offerings.
item.content:encoded:
We’ve a few presentations online – http://edbyrnehq.com/cloud-computing-the-evolution-of-internet-infrastructure/ – is the most recent one.

The API has been key for us, we’ll be launching it soon, along with a new ‘cloud’ brand distinct from our ‘regular’ managed services offerings.

item.title: By: Conor O'Neill
item.dc:creator: Conor O'Neill
item.description:
You guys have any screencasts etc on your cloud offering?
Make sure to let us know when the API goes live, that'll be very interesting to a lot of people!
item.content:encoded:
You guys have any screencasts etc on your cloud offering?

Make sure to let us know when the API goes live, that’ll be very interesting to a lot of people!

item.title: By: Stephen McCarron
item.dc:creator: Stephen McCarron
item.description: Not ot mention www.hosting365.com - we've been running a 128 node, 1024 core, 4TB RAM cloud since last March 2007 and are about to deploy a second site with replication and a full API.
item.content:encoded: Not ot mention http://www.hosting365.com/ – we’ve been running a 128 node, 1024 core, 4TB RAM cloud since last March 2007 and are about to deploy a second site with replication and a full API.
